item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

[code]
.386
.model flat, stdcall
option casemap : none

include \masm32\include\masm32rt.inc

.code

main :

MOV eax, “Hello, world!”
print str$ (eax)

end main[/code]

item.title: Hello.java
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

My least favorite language of the ones I know.

Ladies and gentlemen, I present to you - HELLO_WORLD.cob!

[code=cobol] IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.

    PROGRAM-ID.    HELLO_WORLD.
    AUTHOR.        deathschaos9.
    DATE-WRITTEN.  11/12/2012.
    
    ENVIRONMENT DIVISION.
    
    INPUT-OUTPUT SECTION.
    
    FILE-CONTROL.
    
    DATA DIVISION.
    
    FILE SECTION.
   
    WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.

    01 HELLO-WORLD      PIC X(12)   VALUE "Hello World!".

    PROCEDURE DIVISION.

    000-MAIN-METHOD.
        DISPLAY HELLO-WORLD.
    STOP RUN.
    [/code]

item.title: Hello.java
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:20, topic:461845”][quote author=Aftermath link=topic=564790.msg4111880#msg4111880 date=1348603556]

[code]include java.net.;
include java.io.;

public class LonelyServer {
public static void main(String[] args) {
ServerSocket ss = new ServerSocket(43594);
while(true) {
Socket s = ss.accept();
PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(s.getOutputStream())));
pw.println(“Hello there!”);
new Thread(new Client(s))).start();
s.close();
}
}
static class Client implements Runnable {
private Socket sock;

	Client(Sock sock) {
		this.sock = sock;
	}

	public void run() {
		try {
			PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(s.getOutputStream())));
			pw.println("Nope.");
			pw.close();
			sock.close();
		} catch (Exception e) {

		}
	}
}

}
[/code]

There is a nonzero chance of this compiling.
[/quote]
accept() will indefinitely block until a connection is made… the connection attempt is after accept()… or was that the joke?[/quote]

Dunno what’cha talkin 'bout, this here some prime server code.

Edit: Actually yes, it almost compiled. Here’s the fixed version.

[code]import java.net.;
import java.io.;

public class LonelyServer {
public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
ServerSocket ss = new ServerSocket(43594);
while(true) {
Socket s = ss.accept();
PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(
new OutputStreamWriter(s.getOutputStream())));
pw.println(“Hello there!”);
System.out.println(s);
new Thread(new Client(s)).start();
s.close();
}
}
static class Client implements Runnable {
private Socket sock;

            Client(Socket sock) {
                    this.sock = sock;
            }

            public void run() {
                    try {
                            PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(sock.getOutputStream())));
                            pw.println("Nope.");
                            pw.close();
                            sock.close();
                    } catch (Exception e) {

                    }
            }
    }

}[/code]

Read full topic
